cardBackContents.title: Prophecy
cardBackContents.p: The world we dare to imagine.

detailPageContent.title: Origins
detailPageContent.paragraph: I sing not because I chose it, but because the song chose me.

rows:
Canto porque lo quiso la vida
Quién sabe de dónde vino
Desde hace tiempo lo traigo

I sing because life willed it
Who knows where it came from
I’ve carried it for a long time

Canto andando por los caminos
Los pueblos grandes y chicos
Que por cantar es lo mismo

I sing walking down every road
Through villages large and small
For singing makes them all the same

Traigo fuego a tu corazón
También penas en esta canción
Traigo los recuerdos del dolor
Y también señal de amor

I bring fire to your heart
And sorrow in this song
I carry memories of pain
And also a sign of love

Canto para que nunca te rindas
Para que tengas aliento
Aunque sea grande la herida

I sing so you never give up
So you may have breath
Even when the wound is deep

Canto para que estemos unidos
Porque los pueblos que cantan
Tienen un mismo latido

I sing so we may stay united
Because people who sing
Share the same heartbeat

Sé que la historia no cuenta
Vidas de gente corriente
Pero ¿quién es el valiente?
Que me dice a mí a la cara
Que no es soldado el que lucha
Por ser feliz en la vida
Queriendo a los que le quieren
Siempre con una sonrisa

I know that history forgets
The lives of ordinary people
But who among us is brave enough
To tell me, face to face,
That one is not a soldier
Who fights simply to be happy
Loving those who love them back
And smiling through their pain

Mi gente buena no tiene
Color de piel ni bandera
Miramos el mismo cielo en
Cualquier lugar de la tierra
Forjamos nuestro futuro
De corazón y esperanza
Tu libertad es la danza
Y la razón nuestro escudo

My good people carry no
Skin color nor a flag
We all look up at the same sky
No matter where we stand on Earth
We forge our future
With heart and with hope
Your freedom is the dance
And reason is our shield

detailPageContent.title: Stanzas of Intent
detailPageContent.paragraph: Each goal is a movement in the score — the verses that bring our purpose to life.

rows: Movement I: Tune the Instrument
Secure the tools, resources, and fuel to strike the first chord — from grants to gear, all in service of the first notes of creation.
Movement II: Form the Ensemble
Gather voices, build harmony — launch a pilot residency and artist community that begins the chorus of many.
Movement III: Compose the Hall
Design and secure the physical space where our songs can echo. Write the plan. Find the walls. Raise the roof.
Movement IV: Let the Song Sustain Itself
Earn our rhythm — through events, merch, and media — so the music funds its own refrain, with less need for grants and more space for growth.

detailPageContent.title: Rhythms of Action
detailPageContent.paragraph: We follow the rhythms that move both soul and structure. Four verses, many voices.

rows: Verse I: Crafting the Song
Light the First Flame
Create signature works that sing with our themes and summon wide listening.
Verse I: Crafting the Song
Lift the Hidden Voice
Curate and champion voices less heard, until silence becomes symphony.
Verse I: Crafting the Song
Break the Form
Dare the unfamiliar — let story stretch its limbs and take new shapes.
Verse II: Weaving the Circle
Sharpen the Tools
Offer spaces for skill and growth — let artists learn in safety and fire.
Verse II: Weaving the Circle
Gather the Chorus
Build the bonds that hold — in halls, in pixels, in time.
Verse II: Weaving the Circle
Dream the Home
Sketch and name the place to come — the future center that already hums.
Verse III: Opening the Gate
Sing in the Square
Bring our stories to the streetlight — open, alive, and reaching.
Verse III: Opening the Gate
Teach Through Flame
Partner with schools to pass the spark — turn curriculum into chorus.
Verse III: Opening the Gate
Echo Through the Ether
Craft our digital pulse — a presence felt even from afar.
Verse IV: Holding the Frame
Name the Vessel
Root in structure — become a nonprofit to anchor the dream.
Verse IV: Holding the Frame
Summon the Council
Gather minds to guide and watch — a constellation of wisdom.
Verse IV: Holding the Frame
Feed the Fire
Design the flow of giving — grants, gifts, and earned rhythms.
Verse IV: Holding the Frame
Shape the Voice
Carve the words, the look, the feel — our banner and our breath.
Verse IV: Holding the Frame
Tend the Flame
Track what changes, what lasts — measure not just growth, but meaning.

detailPageContent.title: Echoes of Inquiry
detailPageContent.paragraph: Every story needs a form. This is our narrative frame — structured to hold purpose, tension, and trust.
listItems: A protagonist bound to mission — every act moves the plot of public good.
An open arc for funding — built to receive grants and cultural patronage.
Plot armor in the form of tax relief — the state supporting the quest.
A narrator you can trust — with governance as our voice of clarity.
All profits return to the plot — no side characters stealing the story.
Side quests welcomed — volunteers, patrons, readers drawn into the tale.

detailPageContent.title: Call
detailPageContent.paragraph: Some reasons can only be sung.

rows:
Y así que me encontré, sentado aquí
Queriéndote escribir que no hay ningún porqué
Para olvidar los sueños.

And so I found myself, sitting here
Wanting to write to you that there is no reason
To forget our dreams.

Ayer me tropecé, te voy a contar
Con una niña que, saltando en el jardín
Quería coger la Luna.

Yesterday I stumbled — let me tell you
Upon a little girl, jumping in the garden,
Trying to catch the Moon.

No pude evitar quedarme allí a mirar
Cómo esa niña saltaba una y otra vez.

I couldn’t help but stay and watch
How that girl jumped again and again.

Sonriendo me contó que no iba a descansar
Que con la Luna algún día podría jugar.

Smiling, she told me she wouldn’t stop
That one day, she would play with the Moon.

Crecí escuchando que
Hay que pensar con los pies en el suelo
Siempre razonar:
La Luna está muy lejos.

I grew up hearing
We must keep our feet on the ground,
Always be reasonable:
The Moon is far away

Pero me contagió sus ganas de vivir
Que no hay fronteras, que todo puede ocurrir.

But her will to live infected me:
There are no borders. Anything can happen.

En la niña encontré lo que casi olvidé
¡Dame tu mano y la Luna conseguiré!

In the girl I found what I had almost forgotten:
Give me your hand and I will reach the Moon!

Mírame, si con la mano casi llego ya
Solo me falta un suspiro
Quizás otro salto
Y el sueño será

Look at me — with my hand, I almost touch it
All I need is one breath,
Perhaps one more leap,
And the dream will come true.

Créeme
Que no hay mejor manera de pasar
Las noches de luna olvidando las penas
Que hallando las formas de estar

Believe me,
There is no better way to spend
Moonlit nights forgetting sorrow
Than finding ways to be.

detailPageContent.title: Behind of Rhyme
detailPageContent.paragraph: Some beginnings are not loud — they shimmer. A song, a smile, and suddenly, the sky is different.

rows:
Tus ojos me llenan de vida, me transmiten paz
Tu risa, carita divina, me vuelve a emocionar
Y tanto que llego a imaginar
que somos piratas en el mar

Your eyes fill me with life, they give me peace
Your laughter, divine little face, moves me again
So much that I begin to imagine
we’re pirates on the sea

Hay más allá de la nostalgia un lugar
Donde eres capaz de volar entre amapolas
Y conquistar una hermosa isla de cristal
Aquí estoy contigo, no te olvido,
rumbo al corazón del alba voy

There is a place beyond nostalgia
Where you can fly among poppies
And conquer a beautiful island of crystal
Here I am with you, I won’t forget you,
I sail toward the heart of the dawn
